title: Cat. 83.2  A Fisherman Drinking beside His Canoe, 1894
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe  
1894  
Second state of two  
Wood-block print in black ink, with red, orange, yellow, green, blue, violet and brown watercolor and touches of red and orange gouache, on ivory Japanese paper, laid down on cream Japanese paper; 206 × 140 mm (image/primary/secondary support)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, Clarence Buckingham Collection, 1971.785  
Guérin 46, Kornfeld 33 II/II  
For the verso, see fig. 83.2.1

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Henri M. Petiet (1894–1980), Paris, by 1936.

David David-Weill (1871–1952), Paris.

Sold at Hôtel Drouot, Paris, to Robert M. Light (born 1929), Boston, May 25, 1971, lot 113.

Sold by Robert M. Light to the Art Institute of Chicago, Oct. 1971.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">Gazette des Beaux-Arts, Paris, La vie ardente de Paul Gauguin, 1936, cat. 156.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Raymond Cogniat, La vie ardente de Paul Gauguin, with a preface by Henri Focillon, exh. cat. (Gazette des Beaux-Arts, 1936), p. 91, cat. 156.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine E. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 148, cat. 33.

Britt Salvesen, Gauguin, in association with Douglas W. Druick and Peter Kort Zegers, Artists in Focus (Art Institute of Chicago/Abrams, 2001), pp. 100, 111, no. 28 (ill.).

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section other_documentation" id="other_documentation">Inscribed bottom center, in graphite: W4773

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">According to Raymond Cogniat, La vie ardente de Paul Gauguin, with a preface by Henri Focillon, exh. cat. (Gazette des Beaux-Arts, 1936), p. 91, cat. 156. See also Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 148, cat. 33.

According to Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 148, cat. 33. See also Hôtel Drouot, Collection D. David Weill: Estampes de maîtres des XIXe et XXe siècles, sale cat. (Hôtel Drouot, May 25, 1971), lot 113 (ill.).

This work was sold at the auction; Hôtel Drouot, Collection D. David Weill: Estampes de maîtres des XIXe et XXe siècles, sale cat. (Hôtel Drouot, May 25, 1971), lot 113 (ill.). Given that the Hôtel Drouot sale was at the end of May 1971 and it was offered for sale to the Art Institute in October 1971 it is likely it was sold to Robert M. Light at the May Hôtel Drouot sale.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 83.2 A Fisherman Drinking beside His Canoe, 1894.

fig. 83.2.1 Verso of Gauguin’s A Fisherman Drinking Beside His Canoe, 1894. The Art Institute of Chicago, 1971.785.

</section>
